com.miviclin.droidengine2d.util.math

Class Matrix4

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.miviclin.droidengine2d.util.math.Matrix4

  • public class Matrix4
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a 4x4 matrix in OpenGL ES format.
    Author:
    Miguel Vicente Linares
    See Also:
    Matrix

    • Constructor Detail

      • Matrix4

        public Matrix4()
        Creates a new Matrix4.
        The default value is the identity matrix.

    • Method Detail

      • getValues

        public float[] getValues()
        Returns the backing array with the values of the matrix. The following indices can be used to access each value:
        M00, M01, M02, M03
        M10, M11, M12, M13
        M20, M21, M22, M23
        M30, M31, M32, M33
        Returns:
        representacion interna de la matriz en un array

      • set

        public Matrix4 set(float[] values)
        Replaces the backing array of values of this matrix with the specified array.
        Parameters:
        values - New array of values (this array must have 16 elements).
        Returns:
        this Matrix4

      • setValues

        public Matrix4 setValues(float[] values)
        Replaces the values of this matrix with the first 16 values of the specified array.
        Calling this method has the same effect as calling setValues(values, 0).
        Parameters:
        values - Array where the new values are located.
        Returns:
        this Matrix4

      • setValues

        public Matrix4 setValues(float[] values,
                int offset)
        Replaces the values of this matrix with 16 values of the specified array. The specified offset is where
        Parameters:
        values - Array where the new values are located.
        offset - Position of the first element to be copied into the array of values of this Matrix4.
        Returns:
        this Matrix4

      • setIdentity

        public Matrix4 setIdentity()
        Sets this matrix to the identity matrix.
        Returns:
        this Matrix4

      • invert

        public boolean invert()
        Inverts this matrix.
        Returns:
        true if the matrix could be inverted, false otherwise

      • transpose

        public Matrix4 transpose()
        Transposes this matrix.
        Returns:
        this Matrix4

      • multiplyM

        public Matrix4 multiplyM(float[] matrix,
                int offset)
        Multiplies this matrix by the specified matrix. The result is stored in this Matrix4.
        Parameters:
        matrix - 4x4 matrix.
        offset - Offset of the first element of the matrix in the array of values.
        Returns:
        this Matrix4

      • multiplyM

        public Matrix4 multiplyM(Matrix4 matrix)
        Multiplies this matrix by the specified matrix. The result is stored in this Matrix4.
        Parameters:
        matrix - Matrix4.
        Returns:
        this Matrix4

      • multiplyV

        public Matrix4 multiplyV(float x,
                float y,
                float z,
                float w)
        Multiplies this matrix by the specified vector. The result is stored in this Matrix4.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the vector.
        y - Y coordinate of the vector.
        z - Z coordinate of the vector.
        w - W coordinate of the vector.
        Returns:
        this Matrix4

      • multiplyV

        public Matrix4 multiplyV(float[] vector,
                int offset)
        Multiplies this matrix by the specified vector. The result is stored in this Matrix4.
        Parameters:
        vector - This array contains the values of the vector.
        offset - Offset of the first element of the vector in the array.
        Returns:
        this Matrix4

      • setLookAt

        public Matrix4 setLookAt(float eyeX,
                float eyeY,
                float eyeZ,
                float centerX,
                float centerY,
                float centerZ,
                float upX,
                float upY,
                float upZ)
        Defines a viewing transformation in terms of an eye point, a center of view, and an up vector.
        Parameters:
        eyeX - Coordinate X of the eye vector.
        eyeY - Coordinate Y of the eye vector.
        eyeZ - Coordinate Z of the eye vector.
        centerX - Coordinate X of the center vector.
        centerY - Coordinate Y of the center vector.
        centerZ - Coordinate Z of the center vector.
        upX - Coordinate X of the up vector.
        upY - Coordinate Y of the up vector.
        upZ - Coordinate Z of the up vector.
        Returns:
        this Matrix4

        Parameters:

        center - Center vector.
        up - Up vector.

      • setOrtho

        public Matrix4 setOrtho(float left,
               float right,
               float bottom,
               float top,
               float near,
               float far)
        Converts this matrix to an orthographic projection matrix.
        Parameters:
        left - Left limit.
        right - Right limit.
        bottom - Bottom limit.
        top - Top limit.
        near - Near limit.
        far - Far limit.
        Returns:
        this Matrix4

        public Matrix4 setFrustum(float left,
                 float right,
                 float bottom,
                 float top,
                 float near,
                 float far)
        Defines a projection matrix in terms of six clip planes.
        Parameters:
        left - Left limit.
        right - Right limit.
        bottom - Bottom limit.
        top - Top limit.
        near - Near limit.
        far - Far limit.
        Returns:
        this Matrix4
